metadata.Title: CVE-2020-19726 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in binutils libbfd.c 2.36 relating to the auxiliary symbol data allows attackers to read or write to system memory or cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-19726` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: seth-arnold> binutils isn't safe for untrusted inputs.

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3').
